name: Vanguard U.S. Dividend Appreciation Index ETF (CAD-hedged)
longDescription: The investment objective of Vanguard U.S. Dividend Appreciation Index ETF (CAD-hedged) (the ETF) is to track, to the extent reasonably possible and before fees and expenses, the performance of the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index (CAD-hedged) (the Index). The Index is a float adjusted market capitalization weighted index that consists of common stocks in the S&P United States BMI that have followed a policy of consistently increasing dividends every year for at least 10 years, subject to a dividend yield sustainability screen and a 4% company cap at the time of any rebalancing. The U.S. dollar exposure of the securities included in the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index is hedged to the Canadian dollar.
fulldescription: The investment objective of Vanguard U.S. Dividend Appreciation Index ETF (CAD-hedged) (the ETF) is to track, to the extent reasonably possible and before fees and expenses, the performance of the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index (CAD-hedged) (the Index). The Index is a float adjusted market capitalization weighted index that consists of common stocks in the S&P United States BMI that have followed a policy of consistently increasing dividends every year for at least 10 years, subject to a dividend yield sustainability screen and a 4% company cap at the time of any rebalancing. The U.S. dollar exposure of the securities included in the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index is hedged to the Canadian dollar. The fund seeks to track, to the extent reasonably possible and before fees and expenses, the performance of a U.S. equity indexthat measures the investment return of common stocks of U.S. companies that have a record of increasing dividends over time,which Index is hedged to the Canadian dollar. Currently, this Vanguard ETF seeks to track the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index(CAD-hedged) (or any successor thereto). It invests directly or indirectly primarily in stocks of U.S. companies and uses derivativeinstruments to seek to hedge the U.S. dollar exposure of the securities included in the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index to theCanadian dollar.
fullAddress: 22 Adelaide St West, Suite 2500, Toronto, ON, CA
